title: Farmer, who attempted suicide at Shambhu border, dies at Patiala hospital - Hindustan Times
summary:
Farmer Dies After Suicide Attempt at Shambhu Border

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A 55-year-old farmer protesting at the Shambhu border between Punjab and Haryana allegedly died by suicide, marking the second such incident at the protest site within three weeks. The farmer, from Pahuwind in Tarn Taran district, took this extreme step due to frustrations regarding unresolved issues despite ongoing protests for a minimum support price (MSP).

  • The farmer attempted suicide at the Shambhu border.
  • He was later taken to Rajindra Hospital in Patiala where he died.
  • Another farmer had died by suicide just weeks prior due to distress over a leader’s health.
  • Farmer leaders warned of potential unrest if health issues persist among leaders.
“God forbid if anything untoward happens to Dallewal ji, then perhaps the situation may not remain under control of the Central government,” - Farmer leader Abhimanyu Kohar

This incident highlights ongoing tensions at the protest sites and the urgent need for dialogue between farmers and the government.
newTitle: Farmer Dies After Suicide Attempt at Shambhu Border

title: Really worrisome: Supreme Court on Allahabad High Court functioning - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Raises Concerns Over Allahabad High Court's Case Listings

Published on: 09 Jan 2025, 7:52 am

The Supreme Court expressed worry about the operations of the Allahabad High Court regarding case listings during a hearing related to a property dispute involving Uttar Pradesh MLA Abbas Ansari.

  • The Supreme Court is concerned about how cases are being listed at the Allahabad High Court.
  • Justice Surya Kant stated significant issues exist with filing and listing of cases.
  • Abbas Ansari's plea highlighted a lack of timely hearings for his property dispute.
  • Previous directives to the High Court to expedite the hearing were not followed.
  • The Supreme Court ordered status quo at the site in question until the High Court hears Ansari's plea.
“If high courts do this, where does the citizen go?” - Kapil Sibal

The Supreme Court's concern highlights ongoing issues within the High Court, urging immediate action for the sake of justice.
newTitle: Supreme Court Raises Concerns Over Allahabad High Court's Case Listings

title: 19 years, 1 wedding photo, and AI: Kerala’s chilling triple murder mystery solved - Hindustan Times
‘Wind up alliance’: Omar Abdullah on Tejashwi Yadav's ‘INDIA bloc limited to 2024 polls’ remark - Hindustan Times
summary:
Omar Abdullah Reacts to Tejashwi Yadav's Remarks on INDIA Bloc's Future

Date: Jan 09, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah responded to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's comments regarding the INDIA bloc's limitations concerning the upcoming Lok Sabha elections.

  • Tejashwi Yadav indicated that the INDIA bloc's purpose is primarily to defeat the BJP in the 2024 elections.
  • Omar Abdullah stated that there has been no formal leadership or agenda established for the bloc, questioning its future beyond the elections.
  • He emphasized that the alliance shouldn't just exist for the elections, hinting at the need for clarity and active participation from member parties.
“As far as I remember, there was no time limit to the INDIA alliance.” - Omar Abdullah

Abdullah urged the Congress party to justify its leadership within the INDIA bloc, highlighting that their collaboration should extend beyond just the upcoming elections.

title: Bengaluru techie suicide: Wife Nikita Singhania reveals son’s location in Supreme Court hearing - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Techie's Son's Location Revealed in Supreme Court Hearing

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court was informed about the location of a four-year-old boy in a custody battle after the suicide of his father, Atul Subhash. His mother, Nikita Singhania, revealed he is at a boarding school in Faridabad, Haryana.

  • The child is currently at a boarding school in Faridabad, Haryana.
  • The Supreme Court is hearing a custody petition filed by Atul’s mother.
  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9, 2024, leaving behind a note accusing his wife’s family of harassment.
  • Nikita Singhania was granted bail and assured the court of the child's well-being.
  • The Karnataka High Court declined to quash a criminal complaint against Nikita regarding abetting Atul's suicide.
“The child has one surviving parent. His grandmother, while well-meaning, is not the natural guardian.” - Supreme Court Bench

This case highlights the complexities surrounding family disputes and the impact of personal tragedies on custody arrangements.
newTitle: Bengaluru Techie's Son's Location Revealed in Supreme Court Hearing

title: Tirupati stampede: Andhra Pradesh government announces ex-gratia of ₹25 lakh to the kin of deceased - The Hindu
summary:
Andhra Pradesh Government Offers ₹25 Lakh to Families of Tirupati Stampede Victims

Date: January 09, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Andhra Pradesh government has announced an ex-gratia payment of ₹25 lakh to the families of those who lost their lives in a tragic stampede that occurred at token distribution centers for the Vaikunta Ekadasi darshan.

  • Six devotees died in the stampede, with several others injured.
  • The incident took place just two days before the important religious festival Vaikunta Ekadasi.
  • Cabinet ministers visited the hospitals to console the victims' families.
  • A police complaint has been filed regarding the stampede incident.
  • The deceased were from Visakhapatnam and Tamil Nadu, identified as S. Lavanya, Malliga, Buddeti Naidu Babu, Kandipalli Santhi, G. Rajini, and V. Nirmala.
“A pall of gloom descended over SVIMS super specialty hospital and SVR Ruia Government General Hospital campuses in Tirupati over the death of six devotees.”

This event underscores the need for better crowd management during large religious events to prevent such tragedies in the future.
newTitle: Andhra Pradesh Government Offers ₹25 Lakh to Families of Tirupati Stampede Victims

title: Supreme Court orders Centre to introduce scheme for cashless medical treatment in golden hour - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Orders Cashless Medical Treatment Scheme for Accident Victims

Published on: 09 Jan 2025, 6:18 am

The Supreme Court has mandated the Central government to create a cashless medical treatment scheme for motor accident victims during the critical golden hour period.

  • The golden hour is the first 60 minutes post-injury when timely medical treatment can be life-saving.
  • The Court emphasized the Central government's legal obligation to establish this scheme under Section 162 of the Motor Vehicles Act.
  • The scheme is required to be notified by March 14, with no further extensions allowed.
  • A draft proposal from the Centre suggested a maximum treatment cost of ₹1.5 lakh, but the Court found this insufficient.
  • The implementation of Section 164-B, aimed at creating a motor vehicle accident fund, is also pending.
“The scheme must be such that it serves the object of saving lives by providing immediate medical treatment in the golden hour.”

The Court's directive aims to ensure that victims receive swift care to prevent unnecessary fatalities resulting from delays in medical treatment.
newTitle: Supreme Court Orders Cashless Medical Treatment Scheme for Accident Victims

title: RGNUL Registrar Anand Pawar suspended over sexual harassment, misconduct - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
RGNUL Registrar Anand Pawar Suspended Over Sexual Harassment, Misconduct

Published on: 09 Jan 2025, 6:12 am

Dr. Anand Pawar, the Registrar of Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law (RGNUL), Patiala, has been suspended following serious allegations of sexual harassment, academic and administrative misconduct, and financial irregularities.

  • Pawar faces accusations of bigamy, as confirmed by a previous ruling from the High Court of Madhya Pradesh barring him from remarrying.
  • He has been accused by an Assistant Professor of sexual harassment, leading to a legal compensation order of ₹3 lakh in favor of the complainant.
  • Further allegations include financial misconduct where Pawar misused his position to secure personal benefits, including special allowances and misuse of university assets.
  • The suspension order prevents him from tampering with evidence and mandates an inquiry into other unmentioned allegations.
“Your conduct is against decency, and morality and involves moral turpitude. Your conduct lacks integrity and is unbecoming to hold such a high office.”

The university's administration aims to ensure a thorough investigation into the serious allegations against Pawar.
newTitle: RGNUL Registrar Anand Pawar Suspended Amid Allegations of Misconduct

title: Knowledge nugget of the day: ‘Rat-hole’ mining - The Indian Express
summary:
Knowledge Nugget of the Day: ‘Rat-hole’ Mining

Publication Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Take a look at the essential events, concepts, terms, quotes, or phenomena every day and brush up your knowledge. Here’s your knowledge nugget for today.

Key Takeaways:

  • Rat-hole mining is a method of extracting coal from narrow, horizontal seams, prevalent in Meghalaya. The term 'rat hole' refers to narrow pits dug into the ground, typically just large enough for one person to extract coal.
  • Miners descend using ropes or bamboo ladders to reach coal seams, extracting coal using primitive tools like pickaxes, shovels, and baskets.

Why in the news?

In Dima Hasao district of Assam, at least nine workers aged between 26 and 57 were trapped in a coal “rat-hole” mine after it was flooded. Three miners were confirmed dead, and six remain stuck as emergency teams work to rescue them.
newTitle: Knowledge Nugget of the Day: ‘Rat-hole’ Mining

title: Clear night sky pushes temperature further down in J&K - Greater Kashmir
Second Suit On Same Cause Of Action Must Be Filed Within 3 Years Of Rejection Of Earlier Plaint : Supreme ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Rules on Time Limit for Subsequent Suits

Publication Date: January 8, 2025 Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has clarified that a second suit based on the same cause of action must be filed within three years of the rejection of the earlier plaint, affirming that limitations must be complied with under the Limitation Act.

  • The Court rejected the argument of filing a fresh suit after prior rejection as permissible by CPC Order VII Rule 13.
  • It concluded that subsequent suits beyond the three-year limit are barred by limitation law.
  • The judgment was made by Justices BV Nagarathna and N Kotiswar Singh.
  • The case involved an appeal against a Madras High Court decision regarding a suit filed nine years after the prior plaint was rejected.
“While filing a subsequent suit after the rejection of an earlier plaint is not prohibited, such a suit is maintainable only if filed within the stipulated three-year limitation period.”

The decision emphasizes the importance of adhering to the limitation period, reinforcing the existing law that requires compliance for subsequent suits to be valid.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rules on Time Limit for Subsequent Suits

A tragic stampede near the Tirupati temple resulted in six fatalities and multiple injuries during the distribution of ‘darshan’ tokens, prompting officials from Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) to promise serious action.

  • The stampede occurred near Vishnu Niwasam during token distribution.

72-year-old cancer patient in Bengaluru dies by suicide after being declined Ayushman Bharat scheme benefit: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Hindustan Times

A 72-year-old Bengaluru resident died by suicide after being declined coverage under the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) for treatment of gastric cancer.

  • The patient learned that he would not receive the promised ₹5 lakh benefit just 15 days after his cancer diagnosis.
  • The Kidwai Memorial Institute Of Oncology denied treatment benefits, citing that state government orders had not arrived.
  • Initial scans cost ₹20,000, and further chemotherapy sessions were planned.
  • The Karnataka government is yet to implement the AB PM-JAY senior citizen scheme.
“We planned on starting two rounds of chemo at Kidwai itself. We were ready to pay, but then we lost him to suicide in just two days.”

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for better implementation of healthcare schemes to support vulnerable populations.
newTitle: Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

title: Elon Musk backs Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's ‘Pakistani grooming gang' post: 'True' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk Supports MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's Statement on Pakistani Grooming Gangs

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Elon Musk has voiced his support for Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi regarding her assertion about the use of the term 'Asian' in relation to grooming gangs predominately composed of men of Pakistani heritage in the UK.

  • Musk backed Chaturvedi's post asserting that these gangs should be identified as 'Pakistani grooming gangs'.
  • The controversy was ignited by UK PM Keir Starmer’s remarks surrounding a child sexual abuse scandal.
  • Chaturvedi criticized the broad categorization of 'Asian', asserting that it unfairly implicates all Asian communities.
  • The matter has spurred calls for a new inquiry into the incidents involving child exploitation in northern England.
  • Groups from the Indian diaspora in the UK have echoed Chaturvedi's calls for accuracy in identifying the perpetrators of these crimes.
“Repeat after me, they aren’t ASIAN Grooming Gangs but PAKISTANI grooming gangs,” said Priyanka Chaturvedi, to which Elon Musk replied ‘True’.

The discussion underscores the need for precise language in addressing sensitive social issues surrounding criminal activities and community reputation.
newTitle: Elon Musk Supports MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's Statement on Pakistani Grooming Gangs

title: Maha Kumbh 2025: How Warrior Naga Sadhus Lead Festivities? Unknown Facts About Female Ascetics - News18
summary:
Maha Kumbh 2025: Insights into Naga Sadhus and the Role of Female Ascetics

Last Updated: January 09, 2025

Source: News18

India's Prayagraj is gearing up for the Maha Kumbh 2025, attracting millions of pilgrims and showcasing the participation of Naga Sadhus, who have a significant role in the festivities.

  • Naga Sadhus are warrior-ascetics with a rich history dating back to ancient India.
  • They perform the Shahi Snan, a ceremonial bath that marks the start of the Kumbh Mela festivities.
  • Female Naga Sadhus also participate, undergoing a similar initiation process despite differences in attire and lifestyle.
  • Both male and female Naga Sadhus live a life of asceticism, spirituality, and meditation.
  • Their presence adds to the cultural and spiritual essence of the Mahakumbh.
"The Naga Sadhus have remained an integral part of Kumbh Mela... their mysterious lives fascinate people of all walks of life."

This year, the Maha Kumbh is expected to further highlight the spiritual journey of Naga Sadhus, reinforcing their importance in Hindu cultural traditions.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh 2025: Insights into Naga Sadhus and the Role of Female Ascetics

title: Delhi weather: City witnesses sharp drop in temperature, records 6.4 degrees Celsius - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi Weather: City Records a Sharp Drop to 6.4 Degrees Celsius

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

The city of Delhi has experienced a significant decline in temperature, with the mercury dropping to 6.4 degrees Celsius, marking one of the coldest spells of the season.

  • The temperature fell sharply due to a western disturbance affecting northwest India.
  • This is the lowest temperature recorded in October for the city in recent years.
  • Local authorities are advising residents to take precautions to stay warm.
“The sudden drop in temperature is a surprise to many residents, with the coldest nights expected to continue.”

As winter approaches, residents of Delhi are encouraged to remain updated on weather forecasts and to dress appropriately for the dropping temperatures.
newTitle: Delhi Weather: City Records a Sharp Drop to 6.4 Degrees Celsius
